pkgmetadata.longdescription: # CircRLA small library of mech interp tools, primarily focused oninterpreting RL policies (though most of the tools are general).The library has three main components:- **Hooks**: Tools for hooking into PyTorch models that provide simple, safe wrappers around PyTorch forward hooks functionality and allow easy caching, patching and arbitrary hook functions.- **Probing**: Tools for training linear probes on model activations (or any other data), including sparse probes.- **Rollouts**: Tools for running rollouts and collectiong various kinds of data through a unified interface.## InstallationCircRL is available on PyPI, and can be installed with pip:```bashpip install circrl```## UsageA detailed, self-contained demo of CircRL is available in the[CircRL demo notebook](demo.ipynb).## LicenseCircRL is licensed under the MIT license.## CitationIf you use CircRL in your research, please cite according to:```bibtex@misc{circrl, author = {MacDiarmid, Monte}, title = {CircRL}, year = {2023}, url = {https://github.com/montemac/circrl}}```
